channel.title: The Hon. Susana Martinez
channel.description: The Hon. Susana Martinez Governor of New Mexico (Remarks Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Thank you and good evening.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: On behalf of the great state of New Mexico, let me express my gratitude for being invited to speak tonight.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Growing up, I never imagined a girl from a border town could one day become a governor.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: But this is America
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Y, en America todo es posible.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: My parents taught me to never give up and to always believe that my future could be whatever I dreamt it to be.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Success, they taught me, is built on the foundation of courage, hard-work and individual responsibility.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Despite what some would have us believe, success is not built on resentment and fears.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: We grew up on the border and truly lived paycheck to paycheck. My dad was a golden gloves boxer in the Marine Corps, then a deputy sheriff. My mom worked as an office assistant.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: One day, they decided to start a security guard business. I thought they were absolutely crazy-- we literally had no savings, but they always believed in the American Dream.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: So, my dad worked to grow the business.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: My mom did the books at night. And at 18, I guarded the parking lot at the Catholic Church bingos.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Now, my dad made sure I could take care of myself. I carried a Smith and Wesson .357 Magnum -- that gun weighed more than I did!
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: My parents grew that small business--from one 18-year-old guarding a bingo--to more than 125 people in three states.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And sure, there was help along the way. But my parents took the risk. They stood up. And you better believe that they built it.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: My parents also taught me about having the courage to stand for something. So, I went to law school and became a prosecutor.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: I took on a specialty that very few choose to pursue ­ I prosecuted child abuse and child homicide cases. Cases that were truly gut-wrenching.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: But standing up for those kids, being their voice for justice, was the honor of a lifetime.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Sometimes you pay a price for standing up.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: When I was a young prosecutor, I got called to testify against my boss. I could have backed down, but I didn't. I stood up to him. And he fired me for it.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: So I took him on, ran against him for district attorney and beat him by a landslide!
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: I fear some of our leaders today have lost the courage to stand up.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: What we have now are politicians. They won't offer real plans, and only stand up when they want to blame someone else.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And I don't say that just because a Democrat is in the White House. I was a Democrat for many years. So were my parents.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Before I ran for District Attorney, two Republicans invited my husband and me to lunch. And I knew a party-switch was exactly what they wanted.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: So, I told Chuck, we'll be polite, enjoy a free lunch and then say goodbye.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: But we talked about issues--they never used the words Republican, or Democrat, conservative or liberal.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: We talked about many issues, like welfare ­ is it a way of life, or a hand-up?
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Talked about the size of government -- how much should it tax families and small businesses?
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And when we left that lunch, we got in the car and I looked over at Chuck and said, "I'll be damned, we're Republicans." This election should not be about political parties. Too many Americans are out of work, and our debt is out of control. This election needs to be about those issues.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And it is the responsibility of both parties to offer up real solutions and have an honest debate. In New Mexico, I inherited the largest structural deficit in state history.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And our legislature is controlled by Democrats.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: We don't always agree.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: But we came together ­ in a bi-partisan manner--and turned that deficit into a surplus, all without raising taxes.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: That's not the kind of leadership we are seeing from President Obama.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: He promised to bring us all together, to cut unemployment, to pass immigration reform in his first year and even promised to cut the deficit in half in his first term.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Do you remember that?
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: But he hasn't come close.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: They haven't even passed a budget in Washington, DC in three years!
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: If he can take credit for government building small businesses, then he can accept responsibility for breaking his promise and adding 5 trillion dollars to the national debt.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Because he did build that.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: As the first Hispanic female governor in history, little girls often come up to me in the grocery store or the mall. They look and point, and when they get the courage, they ask "Are you Susana?" and they run up and give me a hug.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And I wonder. How do you know who I am?
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: But they do. And these are little girls.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: It's in moments like these when I'm reminded that we each pave a path. And for me, it's about paving a path for those little girls to follow.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: No more barriers.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: In many ways Mitt Romney and I are very different. Different starts in life. Different paths to leadership. Different cultures. But we've each shared in the promise of America, and we share a core belief that the promise of America must be kept for the next generation.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: El sueno Americanos es tener exito.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: It's success.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Success is the American Dream.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And that success is not something to be ashamed of, or to demonize.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: There is one candidate in this election who will protect that dream, one leader who will fight hard to keep the promise of America for the next generation.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: And that's why we must stand up and make Mitt Romney the next president of the United States.
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez

item.title: Thank you! ###
item.author: The Hon. Susana Martinez
